intro: Elatostema ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous elatostema, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features a short, upright stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, stinging hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema ambiguum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky crevices.
